questions.question_text: Which GLOBALS parameter is required to initially enable monitoring?

choices.D: Oracle Database 12c or greater, Integrated Extract, and GoldenGate 11.2 or greater
choices.A: Oracle Database 11.2.0.3 or greater, Integrated Extract, and GoldenGate 12.1 or greater
choices.B: any version of Oracle Database, Integrated Extract, and GoldenGate 11.2 or greater
choices.C: Oracle Database 11.2.0.4 or greater, Integrated Extract, and GoldenGate 12.1 or greater

questions.question_text: Which combination of DBMS, Extract, and GoldenGate version is required to avoid using a DDL trigger?
You want to eliminate the reporting output from processing a Macro. How should you proceed?

choices.C: Start the Extract task and then start the Replicat task.
choices.B: Start the Extract task, wait for it to stop, and then start the Replicat task.

questions.question_text: You have configured and added the Extract and Replicat tasks by using the Direct Load method. What do you need to do to get the processes up and running?

discussion.content: A is the correct answer which just start initial-extract task only and Do not start the initial-load Replicat manually.

You start the Golden Gate initial-load process by starting the Extract. Remember, it isnâ€™t necessary to start the Replicat, because GoldenGate does this automatically for the initial load when the initial-load Extract is started. Golden Gate only automatically starts the Replicat for an initial-load Replicat, not for the ongoing-change Replicat. When the load is complete, GoldenGate automatically stops the initial load Extract and Replicat.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
A is the answer as per https://docs.oracle.com/en/middleware/goldengate/non-stop/12.3.0.1/admin/configuring-initial-data-synchronization.html#GUID-412FC2E8-6722-476A-B205-1F07970BE945

https://docs.oracle.com/goldengate/1212/gg-winux/GWUAD/wu_initsync.htm#GWUAD564
Only initial-load replicat is started automatically by initial-load extract.
The change replicat still need to be started manually.
So i think C is correct according to the doc.
In directload method, the parameter starts the replicat automatically .. we only need to start the extract : https://docs.oracle.com/goldengate/1212/gg-winux/GWUAD/wu_initsync.htm#GWUAD564

choices.D: Use Extract and Replicat with the GoldenGate Reverse utility.
choices.C: Run the Reverse Utility on the target database transaction logs.
choices.A: Run Extract and Replicat from the command line.
choices.B: Use Extract and Replicat with the GoldenGate Logdump utility.
